website_summaries.verdict: Go with this bag if you're looking for a large, rugged bag that keeps air and moisture out.
pros: Waterproof compression sack doubles as a dry bag
Can hold a lot of items without stretching out or tearing
Easy to remove any trapped air within the bag
Strong material that will not puncture
cons: These bags are a little on the expensive side and they tend to be a little heavier

customer_reviews.title: Great compression bags.
customer_reviews.text: Use these for camping and brought them on a 4 month backpacking trip through Asia. I use a couple X-Small size bags instead of a larger one to help me organize my clothes. They keep odor in (at least my dirty socks) and water out. I carried my laptop in this bag through monsoon rain to work at a coffee shop. I was soaked but the laptop was dry. The compression straps are tough, I put a lot of force into tightening them down and never feel worried about busting a seam. I highly recommend these bags.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Water Repellent, not Waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this to help compress and keep a sleeping bag dry on a Boundary Waters trip. It worked for that purpose although the sleeping bag was never really exposed to any damp conditions. We did however use it for another use on the trip, and that was to hold food over night. While the sack is water repellent, it most certainly isn't waterproof. We left ours overnight outside in the rain for multiple hours, and the contents inside became wet. It could be because the sack was not compressed and water got in through the eVents (it was rolled shut, just not compressed)? Either way, a "waterproof" sack should be waterproof all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra

customer_reviews.title: Stuff and travel!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! I was able to stuf this:and 2 of these: Stuffing those items in this sack was a must for my recent camping trip upon which I needed all my gear to fit in one piece of luggage which was this : The sack was stuffed completely full and there was plenty of room in the Black Hole bag for food running shoes, cooking gear and clothing for a 3 night stay at Joshua Tree. Which means it took just under half the 60L bag.
customer_reviews.author: Wakenride

customer_reviews.title: Small is perfect for a 2-person tent, rainfly, and footprint
customer_reviews.text: [Note: This is a review for the small size bag] I recently bought a new tent (i.e., Kelty Salida 2-person tent) that didn't come with very functional stuff sacks. I own the medium and large StS bags. I tried putting my tent, rainfly, and footprint in the medium one, but there was just a little too much room. So, I pulled the trigger on the small and viola: perfection! The small dry sack is perfect for a tent, rainfly, and footprint. Here is a photo with a Kleenex box and my dog for scale.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Great for compressing big items!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to size down my huge -20 (norway camping) REI Expedition Sleeping Bag, 700-fill duck down & compressed volume 13.6 liters. I purchased the medium and while I did get it in the stuff sack I was not able to fully fold over the water resistant tab. However once I started cinching the straps it dramatically reduced in size. Also the stuff sack is much more durable than the one that came with the sleeping bag. I'm purchasing a large now for the sleeping bag, keeping the medium for my clothes. Attached you can see my sleeping bag hung up next to the stuff sack and then it in the sack.
customer_reviews.author: zach

customer_reviews.title: Durable and truly waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the XL size. When I first received this dry bag, I tested it by placing clothes on the inside, submerging it under water in the bathtub and left it overnight. The next morning, all the clothes were completely dry!! I usually tie this bag to the outside of my backpack to save space while this dry bag holds my pillow, hammock, sleeping bag, and tarp. I can be sure that my entire sleep system stays dry without worry. I have used this bag for a couple years now and it has held up great! Would highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Best to keep sleeping bag dry and compact.
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfect! Bought these and worked perfectly. My son was going backpacking at Philmont (New Mexico) for 10+days. I was concerned about keeping the down filled sleeping bag dry (in case of rain) and compressing the sleeping bag small enough to fit in one of the compartments in the backpack to save space. This did the trick! I took it to the scout meeting and demonstrated how it worked, all the other parents wanted to order them. Easy to use and compacts everything down really well. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: max

customer_reviews.title: Works for my Bikepacking needs
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my upcoming bikepacking trip. It fits my Marmot Nanowave 45 sleeping bag and my ALPS liner perfectly. I needed a skinnier stuff sack than what the Marmot came with in order to fit in to my handlebar bag. Plus - having my sleeping bag in a waterproof bag is a bonus, because no matter if it rains or not, your tent will be wet from condensation following a night in Florida, so its nice to have my sleep gear separated from the wet tent.
customer_reviews.author: DDD

customer_reviews.title: Must Have
customer_reviews.text: This is truly a must have addition to your backpacking. I used this to protect my down sleeping bag and it did just that. After hiking through and afternoon thunderstorm above tree line and then below, I found out that my rain cover protecting my backpack and contents wasn't protecting. All was wet. All but my sleeping bag, nicely protected by this compression sack. I recommend it from experience.
customer_reviews.author: ayreshead

customer_reviews.title: Why are you reading this? Buy one! You won't regret it.
customer_reviews.text: These friggin' bags are AWESOME! Well worth the investment! Don't have to worry about dropping it off the boat, or getting caught in a torrential rain, or an impending flood. Your clothes and electronics will stay dry no matter what! My wife and I go motorcycle camping, and we no longer get apprehensive when it starts to rain, or have to pack our electronics in ziplocs. With the cinch sack aspect it also let's you pack 3x the amount of clothes into the same duffle bag, so you have no wasted space. If you're going camping, boating, needing to prep for an emergency or just a bug-out bag, this bag is PERFECT!
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this with intent of putting my sleeping bag inside while hiking into spike camp for elk hunting. After taking out my sleeping bag I put food inside and hung from a tree. It is waterproof from rain but I have not submerged it. Nothing has broke during 4-1 week elk hunts. The air does come out while compressing with sleeping bag inside. I am satisfied and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: BCG2012

customer_reviews.title: Great solution to the bulk of down bags, jackets, booties, etc.
customer_reviews.text: Frankly, I've used this pair of Sea to Summit bags I bought only twice - on two snowcamping trips where damp down could be a disaster. Since it did not rain, I can't say anything about the water resistance of the sacks, and since they've been used for only two short trips, I can't say anything about the durability. But I am thrilled by the functionality - the ability to compress the sacks and have air escape through the fabric. Five stars!
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: tremendous for backpacking where you are tight on space
customer_reviews.text: My family and I are using this bag and several of the smaller ones to hold all of our clothes for a 6 month backpacking trip. Love it! This one is quite large and barely fits into my 65 liter pack. It does not fit in my wife's 55 liter pack. But i'm glad it fits in mine, straight up in the main compartment! we are carrying clothes for my wife and two young kids and it packs into a much smaller space than for any other method i can find. the size L one actually fits sideways on my bottom compartment so my pack can carry all our clothes. life saver!
customer_reviews.author: hr

customer_reviews.title: Have been using mine for a few years and LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: I have two different sizes for this sack. Love the quality. It makes your clothes really small, protects valuables, has a helpful handle on the bottom, and is just darn really great quality and design. I've been using mine for few years now and can count on it every time. Not only could you use it for camping, but also traveling as well because it can help you save space in your luggage.
customer_reviews.author: aliceholic

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have For Backpackers
customer_reviews.text: The Sea to Summit eVent Compression dry sack is an excellent product. The large is able to easily fit any sleeping bag and compress it to 1/3 of the size. Tried to fit a North Face Furnace 5 degree bag in the medium and it barely fit, so I would recommend the large instead. The small can fit a 2-person tent with the rain fly without the poles. It could probably fit a 3-person tent with the rain fly as well. I recommend this to backpackers that want to compress items in their pack to be able to fit more gear. The small would also be excellent to store clothes in to keep them dry.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Yancik

customer_reviews.title: they are all great and nothing ever gets wet
customer_reviews.text: I own just about every size Summit, they are all great and nothing ever gets wet. you compress then down nice and easy with the pull straps. I expect to get years of service from these bags Small: I use this to pack my GoLite tent to the size of a softball, including footprint. mind you this tent only weights 2 pounds. Medium: I stuff clothes in one, sleeping bag in another(depending on season) I use the large for colder weather bag. Large: Cold weather sleeping bag, the large size is big so I may stuff some night clothes in there as well with my sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding bag, worked great to consolidate in carry on luggage, actually bought one, then bought a second, absolutely would buy again..... wasn’t sure if we should get mediums or small’s smalls worked out the best...
customer_reviews.author: Tractor Boy

customer_reviews.title: Best dry bags I've used, compression mechanism works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use for the Zion Narrows backpacking to keep my 20-degree sleeping bag dry and was impressed with the bag. It looks sharp, this size fits the sleeping bag, inflatable sleeping pad and inflatable pillow (all sea-to-summit brand) comfortably, and has a really high build quality that I was expecting. Would recommend to anyone that wants a dry bag and the ability to compress it with the straps to save space in their backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Buy once cry once
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic. I fit my hammock, tarp, pillow, poncho loner, and all of the clothes I'll need for a weekend motorcycle trip in the medium sized bag and it only came out to half full. It compressed down to about a square foot of volume without any difficulty. The fabric is very sturdy, and I expect to get a lot of use out of this thing. The price is high, but I'm a firm believer in buying quality the first time and not constantly having to worry that my gear will let me down.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Large size too small for a 30 degree sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Could only fit more than half of a 30 degree sleeping bag in the large size. Thought to exchange it for the XL but there was a charge of $7 to return it, although it was a prime item. The XL was $50 ($49.95). Too expensive! I found sleeping bags that come with a compression bag and cost less. I decided to keep it anyway. I will find some use for it.
customer_reviews.author: AF

customer_reviews.title: I love this bag!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag! It compresses better than the bag my sleeping bag came with, it keeps it dry (it's down, we all know what down does when it gets wet). It's kinda heavy, but it's a dry sack. What can you expect? Highly recommend it, well worth the money. I see myself still using it ten years from now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great size for down quilt.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my 20° backpacking quilt by hammock gear. Would also work for the Enlightened Equipment quilt as well. The size I have would be too small for anything of that temperature range in a sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Whiskeyforbreakfast

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag, Does the Job!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second of these bags, a replacement, as the first wore out. I can compress my sleeping bag so that it will easily fit behind the foot pegs in my sea kayak. The bag must be waterproof as there will always be some water in the cockpit and there is always the danger of flooding due to capsize. The bag never leaked in use. I replaced it after five years of hard use as it appeared that some of the waterproofing was coming off.
customer_reviews.author: D. Yackel

customer_reviews.title: Fit my tent & sleeping bag in one small bag!
customer_reviews.text: This compression sack is incredible! It is well worth the money and more. I was able to fit my teton trailhead sleeping bag as well as my hi-tec v lite tent into one compression sack (the small 7x16) Although the pack is extremely well built, just ensure you take your time compressing and are gentle with the straps and you shouldn't have any issues. will be ordering more in the near future. So happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Chyrl

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely perfect. I used these while an Infantry sergeant and I had these through Ft Drum winters, Ft Polk swamps and Iraq/Kuwait. Will keep your clothing dry and safe in a lot of severe environments. I have packed all sorts of crazy things in these bags and never ran into an issue. Never had one rip/tear/break.
customer_reviews.author: SGT EL

customer_reviews.title: Small was just the prefect size for me.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to carry some spare emergency clothes in my backpack on overnight hikes and Canoe trips. A small Summit holds a LS shirt, T Shirt, Convertible hiking pants, 2 pair of wool socks and underpants, and a microfiber towel. Best of all, it all compressed down to about the size of a football, and tucked neatly into the corner of my Kelty Redwing. I can also assure you, its waterproof based on my last canoe trip. I could not be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Mac

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for years backpacking, camping, and in the military. They work great. After two weeks in the field in almost constant downpours, when EVERYTHING else was wet, at least my socks and uniforms stayed dry. The only drawback is that they make lousy pillows.
customer_reviews.author: Sean E

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for clothing and water-sensitive gear
customer_reviews.text: A recent kayaking trip taught me the value of dry bags; too bad my clothes weren't in one! Naturally, these are not as light as Sea to Summit's compression bags, but they are waterproof and compressible. Since I mainly camp at the beach or lakeside and often kayak my gear in, I keep nearly everything in one of these or in a dry-bag at this point. Except my dog.
customer_reviews.author: Mark T.

customer_reviews.title: If you backpack with any goose down products you need one of these!
customer_reviews.text: I'm an ultralight hammock backpack camper; I have a top quilt and bottom quilt (hammock lingo) that are filled with goose down. Nothing is lighter or warmer but if it gets wet it looses it's insulating properties which could be dangerous; I have two of these and they're great. They're strong and keep things dry. The only minor issue is that they're not super light, mine is aobut 4.2 oz; I've been looking for lighter options but for most backpacking uses I think these are simply perfect. I can fit a top and bottom quilt in one which is basically like two regular sized down sleeping bags so you could use this for your bag and clothes, etc. Gideon
customer_reviews.author: Gideon

customer_reviews.title: Purchased this compression sack for a military poncho liner.
customer_reviews.text: This sack is the perfect size for a military size poncho liner. I folded the liner down to approximate 2'x3' and then rolled is small enough to slide into the compression sack. I was able to fold over the mouth of the sack 3-4 times and then compress it down to about the size of a large cantaloupe. The straps seem durable enough. I would purchase this item again.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher C.

customer_reviews.title: Never backpack w/o one
customer_reviews.text: A perfect piece of gear. Never worry about a wet sleeping bag. Well made with strong materials; I have the lighter grey ultra-sil but use it for clothing, due to the lighter more fragile materials and thinner straps. I carry my shoulder season Mountain Hardwear Ratio 32 down bag in a XS, and a Marmot Helium 15 in a medium. Love this bag. Photos of North Face Aleutian 50 long (summer bag) in eVent XS.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This is my first waterproof compression sack. I found there was a learning curve to getting the air out before rolling. I imagine a small straw would help me keep the rolling area open as I squish out air...
customer_reviews.author: Some Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Water Tight
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 3 of these bags for backpacking. We use 2 of them to keep our clothes dry while backpacking and 3rd one serves as a food bag where bear containers aren't required. The strap on the bottom is solid and allows me to hoist the bag up into a tree without ripping or tearing. The compression is very easy with the eVent technology, rather than having a one way valve to release trapped air, the material itself allows air to escape when compressed but keeps water out. I've used them on several section hikes of the AT (Appalachian Trail) to keep my gear/clothes dry, next I can't wait to take them on our next overnight kayak adventure.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Get the 30L if you have a regular sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.text: The 20L is just to small for my sleeping bag, it technically fit but that is more a testament to the quality of the stitching that anything else. You will need a compression sack to fit your sleeping bag into this compression sack.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Mchugh

customer_reviews.title: Awesome water resistant compression sack
customer_reviews.text: Quality. Love the material and the air flow out when compressing. No water in on my last creek crossing ride on the motorbike. Perfect for moto-camping. I fit my small camping pillow and my Teton Tracker +5 mummy sleeping bag with room to spare. Strapped it to the top of my rack on the back along with my tent and sleeping mat. I wouldn't perform a submerge test because the package insert basically states that it is not intended for submersion. Should work great in the rain and when crossing creeks on the bike...
customer_reviews.author: K&A Wags

customer_reviews.title: Great dry bag for cloths
customer_reviews.text: This bag had the less than glorious task of being my socks and underwear drawer for a couple months on a kayak. I was not entirely convinced when I set out that the light weight materials would keep anything dry. Also whatever I put into this bag would have tons of pressed wrinkles because of the compression. In went my unmentionables and I prayed for a dry bum. To my delight it worked great. It compresses down easily forcing the air out of the bottom fabric. Water found it's way into the boat a few times. The content of the bag remained dry as promised.
customer_reviews.author: Tim M.

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: The material is thin, but that also makes them light. Buy bigger than you think you need you can always roll them smaller. This would be perfect for back packing. For rafting where weight does not matter I would recommend a more heavy duty rubberized one.
customer_reviews.author: troy

customer_reviews.title: Great compression bag
customer_reviews.text: Well made product, as expected from a Sea to Summit product. Works great to compress my sleeping bag for kayak camping, which means it needs to be as small as I can get it !
customer_reviews.author: Deb L

customer_reviews.title: and was a terrible situation. We were fortunate to find a hut ...
customer_reviews.text: Got caught in the White Mountains in one of their unpredictable weather storms. Rain was coming in sideways, and even hail! Temperatures dropped, and was a terrible situation. We were fortunate to find a hut that let us stay in their "dungeon", which was just a like 8x8 stone room with triple bunk wooden platforms to sleep on (or store stuff?). Others were stranded with us, and their stuff was soaked through. They had to use emergency blankets. Our stuff was bone dry, and provided much needed comfort after a tough day. So glad we had waterproof sacks!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this dry sack!
customer_reviews.text: The medium size works perfect for my 15° down bag. I love this compression sack, with the event on the bottom I can squeeze all the air out of it and compress my down bag nice and small. Also have had it kayaking and have not had anything get wet. A little pricey but well worth the investment for compressing and keeping my down bag good and dry.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Yeah, it's my bag baby... its my bag!
customer_reviews.text: The SMALL ones fit through the 6.5 inch diameter hatches on my kayak, and are absolutely perfect. Not cheap, but perfect. I have two, and will keep buying them until all of my clothing, bedding (down bag and underquilt), and other soft gear fits inside them. Don't have to burp them, as air is pushed out thru the vent panel. They keep my gear dry inside my kayak, and easily clip around my hammock ridgleline for waterproof storage at the campsite.
customer_reviews.author: geekdout

customer_reviews.title: Excellent waterproof bag. Easy to use and convienient size
customer_reviews.text: Great little water proof compression bag. Easy to pack. Easy to use. Lightweight and just right for a weekend ride on the harley. No more worries about wet clothes when u stop!! Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Deirdriu

customer_reviews.title: Compressed Wonderfully!
customer_reviews.text: I used it to protect and shrink my sleeping bag for 4 day hike and it worked great. My niece used it to get a ton of clothes into small suitcase and she loved the ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: L. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Durable and easily pack-able.  Shrunk my 20 degree bag to smaller than a volleyball.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these one for myself and one for my son after having a not so greaat expeerience with another brand that I also purchased from amazon. These dry compression sacs were ideal on a 7 day canoe trip where the biggest thing I could have for my personal gear was what would fit inside a 30L dry bag. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Stillman

customer_reviews.title: GREAT compression
customer_reviews.text: I use this for motorcycle camping and it was a lifesaver!! I've got a stripped down bike with no storage, yet I was able to compress all my clothes and toiletries for a 4 day campout with room to spare (I bought the medium). Other dry sacks require you to get all the air out, so using them for compression too is difficult. This one expels all the air and the straps are so strong. I'll be getting another, this bag is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Capr

customer_reviews.title: Compression sack
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Was able to fit my sleeping bag and sleeping pad in with no issues and had plenty of room to spare to put clothes in as well.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy M. McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: Fits everything I need in 10 liters
customer_reviews.text: I love these, I own three of them for my backpacking trips. All of them are 10 liters for my clothes, tent, and sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Danny L.

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind for down sleeping bag on multi-day river trip
customer_reviews.text: Great drysack, fits my 10 degree down sleeping bag well with plenty of extra room. I might have been able to fit it into a size small, but am perfectly happy with the medium. Kept my bag dry, easy to compress, good quality. I didn't put it through any serious tests as far as water-tightness, since I used it inside another bag, but I'd trust it for applications like backpacking or occasional rain exposure. Submerging it in a river, probably not.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Stayrook Hobbs

customer_reviews.title: Held up for two months and 2200 miles of stuffing and un-stuffing.
customer_reviews.text: Went on a big bike trip and this was my primary "luggage". I had a tent and sleeping bag jammed inside and, even though there wasn't much rain to deal with on the multi-state, multi-month adventure, it held up well to the few times there was precipitation. I had it filled up TO CAPACITY, probably overstuffed and it survived the trip with (almost) flying colors. There was a bit of a tear near the top at the very end, but it was in a place that didn't affect its permeability. Highly recommend, worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Aderhold

customer_reviews.title: I love the x-small compression dry sack
customer_reviews.text: I love the x-small compression dry sack. Really helps wrench down puffy items. I use this currently on my sleeping back works great, I'll likely get a bigger one for my tent in the future. So I can easily store my tent in my pack without to much worry of getting other gear soaked after packing up in the rain.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Great Compression Sack
customer_reviews.text: I love this sack for keeping my sleeping bag in. I use the large size to keep my down, 15 degree rectangular full-size bag in, and it fits great. The eVent bottom makes it easy to force all the air out of the bag while still being completely waterproof. It compresses my bag down into a canteloupe-sized bundle, easily fitting into my backpack. All the stitching and buckles seem to be high quality, and I haven't experienced any issues with wear or tear. I highly recommend this compression sack!
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Seam tore
customer_reviews.text: As a lightweight waterproof stuff sack, this is one of the best. However, being lightweight does come at the cost of the durability. During my first few months of use, the seam around the folding top tore while carrying my sleeping bag. Since I can't trust the waterproofness anymore, I use it to compress my clothes. Good for what it is, but be careful it's definitely fragile.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Great bag-- reasonably priced, compresses effectively, keeps things inside dry. Isn't bulky so doesn't add much weight or volume to your pack. Depending on the size you get, good for your sleeping bag and/or clothes on a hiking trip. If you ask me, a wet sleeping bag is basically the worst thing ever when you're camping, so sometimes I stuff my sleeping bag into this sea to summit bag, along with a couple of clothing items, for guaranteed dry sleeping and clothes the next morning. Good purchase!
customer_reviews.author: leecountyhokie

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best out there
customer_reviews.text: Thick, sturdy material. Bag is relatively lightweight, and compresses very easily. I'm able to easily get my REI 17 degree sleeping bag into it. Recently this bag spent several minutes fully submerged in an overturned kayak with my sleeping bag in it. Sleeping bag stayed completely dry. Worth every penny for that alone.
customer_reviews.author: Sam S

customer_reviews.title: they were a bit dirty, but otherwise in good condition
customer_reviews.text: We purchased 3 of these for my husband and 2 boys for a trek to Philmont. They used them with their Kelty Tuck 22 Degree Sleeping Bag. They went to Philmont during rainy season. They were frequently rained and hailed on during the trek, but their sleeping bags stayed dry with these bags. After a 12 day trek, they were a bit dirty, but otherwise in good condition.
customer_reviews.author: MultiplesMom

customer_reviews.title: Great product but cost too much.
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. Been using it on tons of trips. Made well. My opinion is they are way too much money. Knowing that I’d still buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Edward N.

customer_reviews.title: High Quality and Durable.  Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Probably our best purchase for a recent trip to Vietnam. We traveled light and compact. This was our bag for compacting our clothes, worked perfect. We'll be using these compression sacks for a long time!
customer_reviews.author: AZ Hobo

customer_reviews.title: It fits perfect and bonds securely in the vacant spot on the ...
customer_reviews.text: Got the Large eVent and put my North Face short down bag in there. No real issue with stowing. Could be hard with a new mummy or long/ square end sleeping bag. It fits perfect and bonds securely in the vacant spot on the lower portion of my Maxpedition Gyrfalcon.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Dad

customer_reviews.title: I swear by these bags, this is #3 for ...
customer_reviews.text: I swear by these bags, this is #3 for me. They've gone through downpours on motorcycles and full submersion without a drop of water, and they even seem to dry what's inside (i.e. put wet stuff in, get dry stuff out even when it's damp outside). How they do it, I dunno. They're the closest thing to magic I've bought.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Good Compression Sack
customer_reviews.text: Compresses nice and its easy to use. Also very lightweight for a compression sack. Not 100% waterproof though, if pressed againt a soaking wet backpack wall for a period of time, water will wick through. E-Vent feature works well for compressing extra small.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Man Bob

customer_reviews.title: Love these stuff sacs
customer_reviews.text: Love these stuff sacs. They hold up even after months of wear and tear. I haven't tested them by completely submerging them but I have had them on the outside of my pack for hours during heavy rain and they keep the contents dry.
customer_reviews.author: Riley

customer_reviews.title: Easy, Robust
customer_reviews.text: Waterproof stuff-sacks are great. Even in a downpour, even if your backpack isn't perfectly waterproof, your sleeping bag will remain dry in a waterproof stuffy. Personally I don't take chances: the stuff-sack lives underneath the waterproof flap of my backpack and the sleeping bag itself is inside a Gore-Tex shell, but that may be overkill. This stuffy is easy to use, robust, and large enough even for my military-style multi-layer bag.
customer_reviews.author: Allan M. Lees

customer_reviews.title: Compression is GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: Liked the first one I got so much that I ordered another in a different size. What I like about these and how these stand out over others is that you can compress a lot and pull the straps tighter than most compression bags and it will still hold. I use these for backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loved the sack
customer_reviews.text: This dry sack was great. I was able to get my clothes for a week trip and a memory foam pillow cut in half and compress to the size on a basketball. Much safer than a garbage bag inside the large dry bags.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: A must for canoeing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 2 years ago and I'm still impressed at how well this thing works. I have the X large and I keep my spare clothes and a 35 degree Big agnes sleeping bag in it. It all fits with room to spare. If your on the fence about what size to get, order the next size up. Its a compression sack so you don't have to worry about wasting space. Plus, its not worth the head ache of trying to load something into a compression sack that barely fits.
customer_reviews.author: minotaur

customer_reviews.title: Great dry bag, very good quality
customer_reviews.text: Made very well, high quality, I got the xtra small and fit a pair of light cargo pants, a under armour cold weather thermal compression top, under armour cold weather thermal compression pants, a white t shirt, and a pair of wool socks. It compressed very nicely, about 7in around and about 9in long, it could compress more if I needed it to and it could hold more also. I would highly recommend this if you need a good dry bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product. The seems are taped and no water will get through them. I bought this to compress my sleeping bag and the compression straps work great. I love the EVENT material, when compressing the bag it lets out all the air without letting it back in. My sleeping bag shrank to half the size that it was when it was in the original stuff sack the bag came with. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who needs to compress there clothing or sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: jon

customer_reviews.title: Great product...Good Price
customer_reviews.text: I used this product to protect my down topquilt on my backpacking trips. Anyone who has had experience with down knows that once it is wet, it takes forever to dry out. I took this compression sack on a 4 day/3 night backpacking trip. We experienced a lot of rain and my down topquilt stayed dry. I haven't dunked the product yet to see just how good it keeps out water, but under normal circumstances I am confident in this sack ability to keep my items dry.
customer_reviews.author: Adam D. Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Worth the Price
customer_reviews.text: Performed as advertised on a long canoe/camping trip, everything inside stayed dry. To give you an idea of how much this will hold inside, I was able to fit a Coleman North Rim Zero-Degree bag as a test, but that was about the limit of what would fit comfortably (I'm sure some people may be able to force feed a bit more into it but I wasn't interested in trying). When I actually used this item I packed a bunch of clothes and had plenty of room to spare.
customer_reviews.author: R. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Used several of these bags for use in the field as part of work (Army) and for personal use. Never had clothes or sleeping bags get wet, they’ve held up for five years with regular use, and do a great job of compressing to save space.
customer_reviews.author: Nick H

customer_reviews.title: Compression Sacks
customer_reviews.text: I can pack at least double the supplies in same bag using these.
customer_reviews.author: Chris M Sekora

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for sleeping bag and pillow and possibly more! This is the biggest one! The same quality one they sell at REI for double the price as this one
customer_reviews.author: Heather Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Perfect - well made and great compression
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 30L for my Enlightened extra tall and wide down quilt - and I could have mostly likely done the 20L. Regardless it works great. Well made, easy to cinch down.
customer_reviews.author: Q. Gessner

customer_reviews.title: but the next size up would have been better.
customer_reviews.text: This bag is constructed of solid materials, and will definitely keep items dry. I purchased it as a replacement compression sack for a sleeping bag... that being said, it did (just barely) accommodate my 20° mummy bag... but the next size up would have been better.
customer_reviews.author: PNWild

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat it.
customer_reviews.text: Sea to Summit gear is top notch. I have a synthetic mummy sleeping bag that I needed to scrunch down and keep dry in my pack this baby did the trick. Mine is half again as small as the original compression bag it came in and I really cranked down on the straps to get this baby smaller. Everyone should own a couple of these bags.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great product! I only question the fabric part that ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product! I only question the fabric part that goes over the top buckle. I feel long term it may be subject to abrasion. But it seals well and compresses small. I put a surplus poncho liner in an extra small. Recommend a small if you try the same, its a tight fit.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Bylsma

customer_reviews.title: Great for condensing items
customer_reviews.text: Really helped me to condense my clothing size when traveling. I used the small, and large on a round the world trip and I was able to keep organized and condense my cloths to fit in a 50L back pack with these bags. I would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Jaisy D. Azevedo

customer_reviews.title: Best deal for the price
customer_reviews.text: When I first got it the outside grey material seemed cheap and thin, but its performance proved that not to be the case. I went on a canoe trip and was able to stick all of my clothes and my sleeping bag in the extra large. I was able to compress it to about 1/2 the size even when it packed full uncompressed. I never submerged it, but it was sitting in a half inch of water the whole trip. Not a drop of water got in.
customer_reviews.author: shredder

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Works really well I used it camping this past week it works great! I got the medium size bag which is like 14 gallons. This is better quality than others I’ve had.
customer_reviews.author: Nea2p

customer_reviews.title: Outperforms description
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected and worth the money when you socks and underwear are in it! Slipped my touring kayak in freezing wv mountain river water this spring and worked perfect actually outperforming what I expected it to do and kept everything dry while being submerge or about 20 min. Everything was kept dry. Would buy again
customer_reviews.author: MTB cyclist

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I use this bag as a stuff sack for my sleeping bag. Works great and easy to compress.
customer_reviews.author: J Po

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use, Dry...for real
customer_reviews.text: I have a huge sleeping bag, and toting it everywhere is kind of a pain. My original bag didn't come with a stuff sack to put it in, so this served the purpose well. This compression sack is easy to use and kept my sleeping bag dry, even in a trailer full of wet waders! I plan on buying more to pack my clothes in. Great buy, and worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Kasandra

customer_reviews.title: Stay Dry in all Conditions
customer_reviews.text: I was the only one on my last hunting trip to have a dry sleeping bag, this thing saved the trip for me!
customer_reviews.author: Brock & Jess

customer_reviews.title: Keeps your stuff dry!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a 6 day backpacking trip that included multiple river crossings in SW New Mexico. It did its job, keeping my essentials dry after falling while crossing the river a couple times! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Haralson

customer_reviews.title: Great for motorcycle camping
customer_reviews.text: This medium sized compression sack is perfect for a down sleeping bag..even a 0 degree size. On a motorcycle, size is more important than weight. This bag works very well and is waterproof. I bungie my wife's and my sleeping bags in these sacks to ride on top of the saddlebags next to the rear seat. The manufacturing seems to be first rate. No seams are strained. No buckles broken. I'm not going to try a dunk test, but in mild rain, the bags came out perfectly dry. Never store a sleeping bag compressed, but for traveling, this Sea to Summit brand is a good choice. John
customer_reviews.author: John T. Gardner

customer_reviews.title: The best compression sack
customer_reviews.text: These are simply the best. The eVent material makes squeezing excess air out of the bag super simple and the compression mechanism is very robust, I have used it to compress very tightly and have not had to worry about the seams tearing or anything. At this point, I can not comment on the waterproofness of this item.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Martini

customer_reviews.title: I was amazed how much stuff I was able to stuff into ...
customer_reviews.text: I was able to stuff my Nemo side sleeping bag and other dry shirts/socks/gloves into this bag and compress it to fit into the back of my kayak storage. I was amazed how much stuff I was able to stuff into this bag. I will buy more of these bags.
customer_reviews.author: R. Le

customer_reviews.title: These work great. I have a few of these now
customer_reviews.text: These work great. I have a few of these now. one for my summer patrol bag and the other for my USMC 3 season bag. I have used them on 100s of miles of hiking and find them to work great. ultra light and better then what comes with whatever bag came with your original gear.
customer_reviews.author: @LonestarCanuck

customer_reviews.title: Great Drysack
customer_reviews.text: Nice drysack! I took it in the backyard and sprayed it generously with the hose and all of the things inside stayed dry. I got the Large bag and it held a 30 degree mummy bag with a couple pairs of socks, underwear, and a t-shirt with some room to spare.
customer_reviews.author: therealrc2

customer_reviews.title: Worlds best compression sack
customer_reviews.text: This keeps my down sleeping bag dry in harsh conditions. The eVENT technology allows for maximum compression and compatibility. I highly recommend this to anyone with a down sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Owen

customer_reviews.title: Every backpacker needs a few of these. Clothes, ...
customer_reviews.text: Every backpacker needs a few of these. Clothes, sleeping bags, mattresses, first aid kits and anything highly permeable or flexible can be compressed in here and save tons of space. If you're not shy on space they are marvelous for organization.
customer_reviews.author: paws

customer_reviews.title: Four hours in water
customer_reviews.text: Awesome sack, I towed it behind my kayak for 4 hours in 40-50 degree water, and everything was completely dry when I pulled it out. This latest trip I used it for my sleeping bag (I got the small compression sack) because by compression sack that came with my bag tore when I was tightening the straps. This bag is super durable and I don't see the straps tearing on me anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: I use this for my zero degree down quilt (for ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my zero degree down quilt (for the record, it's an Enlightened Equipment Enigma, short length, slim width). The small-sized sack, fully packed with the quilt and compressed, leaves me a hilarious amount of room in my backpack.
customer_reviews.author: H.

customer_reviews.title: Durable and waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Great for thru-hiking. Not the strongest available, but I've never had a problem with ripping, tearing, wearing, etc. Not the thinnest either, but you don't have to worry about puncturing it on a stick. If you use it to carry your sleeping bag, use it to hang food at night or fill it with stuff and use it as a pillow - relatively soft and quiet.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertized, surprized by high quality
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these for a 3-day backpacking trip. Absolutely no complaints. Everything stayed dry through a light rain. I managed to fit a 20-degree down large male sleeping bag into a SMALL sized bag without much trouble. The seams and straps are strong as I was able to compress the bejeezus out of my clothes and sleeping bag without ripping anything.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great compression sack
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these bags in various sizes. This bag is very large. I was able to fit a 15 degree down bag, therm a rest pillow, and a week's worth of clothing in this compression sack. These sacks are very durable and compress very well.
customer_reviews.author: Bcopley1116

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but pricey
customer_reviews.text: Really cool product. Good quality so far, but just used a few times. Only downside is it's pretty expensive for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: jtsnake

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and keeps everything dry
customer_reviews.text: Great bag and nice that it compresses the air out. Some complain about the air going out too slow; I found that you compress the bag down (put a knee on it) and then roll it tight. The rest of the air left can then be squeezed out through the membrane. I used this on a back country canoe trip and it worked great for my cloths, sleeping bag and pillow (XL).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be very durable and works well for my sleeping bag. Very pleased
customer_reviews.author: -nick

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE FOR BACKPACKING
customer_reviews.text: Great compression sack. I bought it for a 0 degree down sleeping bag. Compresses down small enough to fit in backpack with ease. Highly recommend. I bought a 14 and 20 liter sizes.
customer_reviews.author: LURP

product_meta.title: Sea to Summit Event Compression Dry Sack
feature_bullets: Sturdy 70D Nylon waterproof fabric in the body and lid, eVent waterproof/air-permeable base
Best use: The best dry bag/compression sack for sleeping bags & other bulky yet compressible items
Capacity: 20 liter - a tent or any small sleeping bag
Compressed: evenly compresses down to 1/3rd orinial volume with 4 straps; 20L to 6.7L
Features: double stitched, waterproof tape seams. Hypalon rolltop closure. 4 Extra long straps with reinforced stress point. Pull handle on the bottom
Fabric: Sturdy 70D Nylon waterproof fabric in the body and lid. eVent waterproof/air-permeable base fabric

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
